tones.Conversational: Write an email as a friend who's interested in the same hobby as you, telling them about a new item. Use a conversational tone to make it feel like you're catching up over coffee or chatting on the phone. Be sure to include details about why you love this item and how it fits into your collection or hobby.
tones.Formal: Use a formal tone to convey professionalism and authority. Start with a clear subject line and a formal salutation. Use precise and concise language.
tones.Humurous: Use a humorous tone to make the email engaging and entertaining. Start with a catchy subject line that piques their interest and includes a playful pun or joke. Use humorous language to describe the product and its features. End the email with a call-to-action that encourages the customers to try the product and provide feedback.
tones.Urgent: Use an urgent tone to create a sense of urgency and encourage them to take immediate action. Start with a subject line that conveys the urgency of the offer and includes a clear call-to-action. Use language that emphasizes the scarcity of the offer and the benefits that the customers will receive by acting quickly.
